result.execSummary:
The defendant Daryl J Copus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daryl J Copus is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daryl J Copus was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.
Bond applied, $7 VW surcharge balance to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.

Court reporter Lynn Schultz. Defendant Daryl J Copus in court.  Attorney Haley Ruesch Watson in court for Daryl J Copus.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 5.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 1, 2, 3, 4. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT # 5
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 20 days in Dane County Jail, with Huber; to commence  cs to 21CM2109

-Days credit to jail: 15 days

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 5

- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-The Court orders DNA sample

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

[Jo W]

Cash bond is set in the amount of $60 (per case). $10 previously posted to apply. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall not be at any Super 8 Motel in Dane County. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with AR. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol.
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Daryl J Copus in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley Ruesch Watson in court for Daryl J Copus.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. In court today for bail/bond hearing after return on warrant in cases 21CM1732, 21CM1733, 21CM1771, 21CM1818, 21CM1865, 21CM1906, 21CM2109 and 22CM1040. State gives argument and requests $100.00 per case. Atty Watson gives argument and requests $50.00 per case. Court makes findings and will increase cash bail in all cases by $50.00. Court will also order pretrial services for GPS monitoring in each case. All other bail conditions will remain the same. 

21CM1732- Court orders an increase of cash bail by $50.00, for a total of $60.00. Previously posted cash bail is to be applied to the new bail. Court orders DCPS for GPS monitoring. All other bail conditions will remain the same.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

02:43 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jacob A Idlas.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
